segments.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You knew there was nothing in that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I knew nothing of the sort. You took presents from him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Presents? It was only a small trivial little broach.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I remember it well. Bristling with diamonds. In the worst possible taste.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not at all. It was very pretty. And I wear it all the time. I still have it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, I didn't. You made that up all in your jealous imagination.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You must admit that he was in love with you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just a little perhaps, but it was nothing serious.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You let him kiss you. You said so.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, what of it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh come on, it gave him a lot of pleasure and it didn't harm me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What about me?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, if you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey you'd have never known anything about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's a nice point of view, I must say.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, it's true.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Are you bored with this conversation?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I definitely, most definitely am.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So am I. Bored stiff. Want some brandy?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, thanks.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll have a little, I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't see why you want it; you've already had two glasses.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No particular reason. Anyhow, they were very small ones.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't see what's the point of going on and on about something like this.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, my-you can hardly call three minute liquor glasses in the evening going on and on and on.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's become a habit with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You needn't be so grand just because you don't happen to want some yourself at the moment.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't be so stupid.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Really, Amanda.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nothing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Going somewhere, dear?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No. Just making myself fascinating for you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That reply has broken my heart.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's a woman's job to allure the man. Watch me, won't you, a minute?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, it isn't.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes, it is.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, it's not. I don't care.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's a pity you didn't have more brandy. It might have made you a little less disagreeable.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, it didn't seem to do such wonders with you, now did it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Adders don't snap, they sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes, they do. They have a big bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't care. I don't care, do you understand? I don't care if they bark, if they roll over on the floor like hoops.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Uhh,
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes, I did, quite a lot actually.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I imagine that you let him kiss you quite a bit more then, didn't you?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Mind your business.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You had a riotous-must have had a riotous time. No restraint at all. Very enjoyable. You never had much anyhow.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You are quite insufferable. I suppose it's because you're drunk.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'm not in the least bit drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You've always had a weak head.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Okay. As I mentioned before, I said I had three very minute liquor glasses. That's hardly enough to get a child of two drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: On the contrary, a child of two can get violently drunk on only one glass of brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, very interesting indeed. How about a child of four or a child of six or a child of nine. We might have a splendid little debate about this intemperate tots.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Do shut up. Shut up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't want to talk about this anymore.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You better turn that off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's very late and it will annoy the people upstairs.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There aren't any people upstairs. It's a photographer's studio.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, I suppose the people downstairs then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They're away in Tunis.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: This is no time of the year for Tunis.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Turn it on again, please.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No, I will do no such thing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Turn it on.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You've always had far too temperamental for yourself. You should try to control it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I will not. Go away. Go away. I hate you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, very amusing, indeed. Amanda, listen-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Listen, indeed. No, no, no, no. I am sick and tired of listening to you, you sadistic bully.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Very amusing indeed.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Stop it, stop it, I hate you, I loath you, you are overbearing and conceited and utterly impossible.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You know, you're a vile, ill-tempered, wicked little beast and I hope that I never see you again as long as I live.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: This is the end. Do you hear? The end. Now and forever.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No, you're not going out like this. No you're not.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, yes I am.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes I am. Let go of me. I hate you and I loath you. God, I can't believe I just finally realized how you are. I am never marry you. Never. Never, never, never. I would rather die in torment.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, shut up. Shut up. Shut up.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I wouldn't marry you again if you came back crawling to me on your hands and knees because you're vile. You're a mean, evil-minded little vampire and I hope to God I never set eyes on you again.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Beast or brute cad, swine beast beast brute.
segments.speaker: F
